content.question: Which of the following best describes the process that adds a monosaccharide to an existing polysaccharide?

choices.label: The monosaccharide is completely broken down by a specific enzyme and then the atoms are reorganized and made into a polysaccharide.

Ionic bonds are formed between adjacent carbon atoms of the monosaccharide and the polysaccharide by adding water <math alttext="open parenthesis, H 2 O, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>(H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and a specific enzyme.

A specific enzyme removes the hydrogen (<math alttext="H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) from the monosaccharide and the hydroxide (<math alttext="O H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) from the polysaccharide, creating a bond between the two and creating a water (<math alttext="H 2 O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) molecule.

A specific enzyme removes two hydroxides <math alttext="open parenthesis, O H, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mtext>OH)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, one from the monosaccharide, and one from the polysaccharide, creating a bond between the two monosaccharides and creating a hydrogen peroxide (<math alttext="H 2 O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>) molecule.

content.answer: A specific enzyme removes the hydrogen (<math alttext="H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) from the monosaccharide and the hydroxide (<math alttext="O H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) from the polysaccharide, creating a bond between the two and creating a water (<math alttext="H 2 O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) molecule.

skill.text: 2.A: Describe characteristics of visual representations of biological concepts and processes.
